summary: An email chain between FBI agents and prosecutors discussing a new victim who came forward with allegations of sexual abuse by Leon Black, facilitated by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell via a coach named Mary. The document details the victim's allegations, investigative steps, and coordination between the FBI and the District Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: A financier accused by a victim of a violent sexual assault in 2001 at Epstein's townhouse, introduced by Epstein for a massage.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier who trafficked the victim, introduced her to Leon Black, and took money Black left after the assault.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Epstein's associate who was introduced to the victim by Mary and was controlling of the victim's body and travel.

persons.name: Mary
persons.context: Also known as Mary Small/Combs/Petit/Fleming, a gymnastics/cheer/dance coach who introduced the victim to Maxwell and Epstein, and was physically abusive.

persons.name: Eddie Small
persons.context: Mary's significant other (Edward Charles Small) who drove the victim from Virginia to New York to Epstein's townhouse.

persons.name: Adam Horowitz
persons.context: Attorney who represented the victim in initial meetings with the District Attorney's Office regarding civil claims against Leon Black.

persons.name: Jeanne Christensen
persons.context: Attorney representing the victim in connection with civil claims related to Epstein and others, including Leon Black.

persons.name: Larry
persons.context: A pilot who flew the victim and others to St. Thomas on Epstein's plane.

persons.name: Staley
persons.context: An individual the victim alleged also abused her, believed by investigators but without independent corroboration.

connections.description: Mary introduced the victim to Ghislaine Maxwell, and they were both controlling of the victim's body and activities.
Mary introduced the victim to Jeffrey Epstein and would receive expensive gifts from him after the victim's trips.
Epstein introduced the victim to Leon Black by name, telling her she would give him a massage, facilitating the alleged assault.
Maxwell and Epstein together trafficked the victim, flying her to various locations and controlling her.
Mary's significant other who assisted in transporting the victim to Epstein's townhouse.
The victim alleges a violent sexual assault by Leon Black in 2001 at Epstein's townhouse, resulting in injury.
Horowitz represented the victim in initial meetings with the District Attorney's Office regarding civil claims.
Christensen represents the victim in connection with civil claims related to Epstein, Black, and Staley.

events.title: Alleged sexual assault by Leon Black
events.description: The victim alleges a violent sexual assault by Leon Black at Jeffrey Epstein's New York townhouse, introduced by Epstein for a massage, resulting in bleeding and needing medical attention.

events.title: Introduction to Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Mary introduced the victim to Ghislaine Maxwell when the victim was 17, as part of what was described as an apprentice program.

events.title: District Attorney's Office interview
events.description: The victim spoke with the District Attorney's Office in January 2023, represented by attorney Adam Horowitz, regarding allegations against Leon Black.

events.title: Memo to file call
events.description: A call documented in a memo summarizing the victim's allegations, investigative steps, and coordination with the District Attorney's Office.

events.title: Civil complaint against Leon Black filed
events.description: A civil complaint was filed against Leon Black with specific allegations about a massage and biting, though redacted at the time.

keyFacts: A new victim alleged a violent sexual assault by financier Leon Black in 2001 at Jeffrey Epstein's New York townhouse, facilitated by Epstein.
The victim was introduced to Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell by her coach, Mary (aka Mary Small/Combs/Petit/Fleming), who was physically abusive and controlling.
The victim required medical attention after the alleged assault by Black, and Epstein took money Black left behind.
Investigators found medical records from 2011-2023 corroborating PTSD and anxiety from sexual assault, though independent corroboration of the Black allegation was not found.
The email chain shows ongoing coordination between the FBI and the District Attorney's Office in 2023 regarding this victim and potential investigation of other traffickers.
